item.title: R: data.table - Finding the maximum row
item.description: > blogDT = data.table(name = c("Property 1","Property 1","Property 1","Property 2","Property 2","Property 2"), price = c(10000, 12500, 18000, 245000, 512000, 1000000), date = c("Day 1", "Day 7", "Day 10", "Day 3", "Day 5", "Day 12")) > blogDT[, lag.price := c(NA, price[-.N]), by = name] > blogDT[, diff := price - lag.price] > blogDT name price date lag.price diff 1: Property 1 10000 Day 1 NA NA 2: Property 1 12500 Day 7 10000 2500 3: Property 1 18000 Day 10 12500 5500 4: Property 2 245000 Day 3 NA NA 5: Property 2 512000 Day 5 245000 267000 6: Property 2 1000000 Day 12 512000 488000 > blogDT[!
